intro: Trichomanes griffithii, commonly known as the Himalayan maidenhair fern, is a rare and ancient fern species native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that resemble those of more primitive ferns. The plant thrives in cool, moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests at high altitudes. Its spores are produced in small, clustered structures called sori, which are typically located on the underside of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Trichomanes griffithii is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
